thread.section_title: Dallas-Fort Worth Book Reviews and News - Entertainment News for Dallas Texas - GuideLive
thread.title: Author tours

author: dallasnews
title: Author tours
text:
Leigh Bardugo will attend the launch party for Six of Crows at 7 p.m. Monday at South Irving Library, 601 Schulze Drive, Irving. The book will be for sale one day early at this event.
Six Sisters’ Stuff bloggers will discuss Sweets and Treats at 7 p.m. Wednesday at Barnes & Noble, 7700 W. Northwest Highway, Dallas.
Anshel Brusilow ( Shoot the Conductor: Too Close to Monteux, Szell, and Ormandy ) will speak at 5 p.m. Wednesday at University of North Texas Murchison Performing Arts Center, 2100 Interstate 35, Denton.
Fiston Mwanza Mujila will discuss Tram 83 at two events:
7:30 p.m. Thursday at The Wild Detectives, 314 W. 8th St., Dallas. Mujila will read in French and his translator Roland Glasser in English.
11 a.m. Friday at Richland College library, Building L, 12800 Abrams Road, Dallas.
Mujila and Glasser will discuss African and Francophone literature at 2 p.m. Friday at Hyer Hall,6424 Robert S. Hyer Lane, Dallas.
C. Alexander London will discuss and sign The Wild Ones at 5 p.m. Friday at Half Price Books, 5803 E. Northwest Highway, Dallas. One numbered pass per person will be available starting at 9 a.m. Friday.
Wm. Paul Young will discuss and sign Eve at 7 p.m. Friday at Texas Christian University Bookstore, 2950 W. Berry St., Fort Worth.
Jamie Brickhouse ( Dangerous When Wet: A Memoir ) will speak as part of Authors at The Adolphus at 11:30 a.m. Friday at the French Room at the Adolphus, 1321 Commerce St., Dallas. $80. Register at hoteladolphus.com/calendar-of-events .
Juli Bauer ( Juli Bauer’s Paleo Cookbook ) and Vanessa Barajas ( Clean Eating With a Dirty Mind ) will discuss and sign their Paleo-inspired cookbooks at 7 p.m. Friday at Barnes & Noble, 7700 W. Northwest Highway, Dallas.
Vivek Pandit will sign We Are Generation Z: How Identity, Attitudes, and Perspectives Are Shaping Our Future at 3 p.m. Saturday at Barnes & Noble, 1430 Plaza Place, Southlake.
Tiffany Sunday will discuss and sign Dyslexia’s Competitive Edge from 1 to 3 p.m. Saturday at Kamit Sport Design Studio, 1122 Commerce Drive, Richardson.
Romance authors Tessa Dare, Katharine Ashe, D.D. Ayres, Linda Broday, HelenKay Dimon, Shana Galen, Nancy Haddock, Barb Han, Sophie Jordan, Diane Kelly, Lizbeth Selvig, Tracy Solheim, Kay Thomas, J.D. Tyler, Becky Wade and Lori Wilde will sign copies of their books at 2 p.m. Saturday at Barnes & Noble, 190 Cedar Sage Drive, Garland. Authors’ books sold at the event will benefit the Richardson Adult Literacy Center book fair.
Compiled by Holly Ann Rusak. Email mmerschel@dallasnews.com at least two weeks in advance.
